name: Common Bond - Bible Character Quiz | Common Bond 10 Questions | 10 Questions

questions.text: In "A Christmas Carol" by Charles Dickens, what was the name of Scrooge's partner who visits him as a ghost: ___________ Marley?
questions.explanation:
Jacob.

	"A Christmas Carol" was first published in 1843. It tells the story of Scrooge who was a miserable man who hated everyone and especially hated Christmas. His old partner Jacob Marley comes to visit and tells him that that night (Christmas Eve) he will be visited by 3 spirits: The ghost of Christmas past, the ghost of Christmas present and the ghost of Christmas yet to come.

questions.text: Ag is the the chemical symbol for _________ .
questions.explanation:
Silver.

	Silver has an atomic number of 47. It's letters on the Periodic Table of the Elements comes from its Latin word which is argentum.

questions.text: What sandwich is made with corn beef, swiss cheese and sauerkraut?
questions.explanation:
Reuben.

	The Reuben sandwich was invented in Nebraska by Reuben Kulakofsky (wikipedia.com).  The sandwhich is made on two pieces of rye bread.

questions.text: What was the name of the lawyer played by John Larroquette on "Night Court"?
questions.explanation:
Dan.

	Dan Fielding was the lecherous lawyer from "Night Court". There once was talk of a spin-off staring Dan Fielding but John Larroquette turned it down.

questions.text: Who did Jennifer Aniston play on "Friends"?
questions.explanation:
Rachel.

	Rachel Green was married to Ross Geller in the final episode of "Friends". They were also married once before accidentally when they were both drunk and got married. They have one daughter, Emily, together.

questions.text: What is another word for maize?
questions.explanation:
corn.

	Corn is a word meaning grain. Corn was domesticated in prehistoric times.

Egypt.

	Egypt is one of the oldest countries in the world. It is located on two continents  (Asia and Africa).

questions.text: What animal's scientific name is "Bos primigenius"?
questions.explanation:
cows.

	Cows are a type of ungulates which means that they have hooves. A male cow is called a bull unless it's been castrated then it is called a steer. A baby cow is called a calf. Wild male cows are called mavericks.

questions.text: Phil Collins was the lead singer of what band?
questions.explanation:
Genesis.

	Genesis was formed in 1967. The bands original members were Tony Banks and Mike Rutherford. Phil Collins joined them in 1970. They had hits with songs like "Down and Out" and "Afterglow".

questions.text: What Bible character do these nine words have in common?
questions.explanation:
Joseph.

	The answer is Joseph: 1) Jacob was Joseph's father2) Joseph planted a silver cup in his brother Benjamin's sack.3) Reuben was Joseph's oldest brother.4) Dan was one of Joseph's older brothers.5) Rachel was Joseph's mother. She died giving birth to his younger brother Benjamin.6) Joseph dreamed that his brother's ears of corn were bowing down to his ear of corn. 7) Joseph was a slave in Egypt and then second in command later on.8) Joseph interpreted the Pharaoh's dream in which 7 skinny cows ate 7 fat cows.9) The story of Joseph can be found in the book of Genesis.
